channel.title: CyberNetSec - Phishing
channel.description: Latest phishing threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Harvard University Data Breach Exposes Donor Information After Phone Phishing Attack
item.description:
Harvard University has disclosed a data breach affecting its Alumni Affairs and Development Office, discovered on November 18, 2025. The incident originated from a phone-based phishing (vishing) attack that gave an unauthorized party access to systems containing personal information and donation rec...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Chicago's St. Anthony Hospital Discloses Data Breach Affecting Over 6,600
item.description:
St. Anthony Hospital in Chicago has reported a data breach that may have exposed the personal and medical information of more than 6,600 patients and staff members. The incident, which was discovered in February 2025, occurred when an unauthorized party gained access to several employee email accoun...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Supply Chain Attacks & AI-Powered Phishing Surge Across Asia-Pacific, Darktrace Warns
item.description:
A new threat report from cybersecurity firm Darktrace highlights a dramatic increase in sophisticated cyber threats across the Asia-Pacific and Japan (APJ) region. The report, covering the 12 months to July 2025, details a surge in supply chain attacks, business email compromise, and cloud intrusion...

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Supply Chain Attack, Phishing

item.title: Vendor Breach Exposes Patient Data at Innovative Physical Therapy
item.description:
Innovative Physical Therapy has notified patients of a data breach that originated from a third-party vendor responsible for practice management. The breach occurred when two vendor employees fell victim to phishing emails, leading to the compromise of their email accounts. Between June 25 and June ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Phishing

item.title: DoorDash Hit by Data Breach After Employee Targeted in Social Engineering Scam
item.description:
Food delivery service DoorDash has confirmed a data breach after an employee was compromised by a social engineering scam, allowing an unauthorized third party to access internal systems. The breach exposed the names, physical addresses, phone numbers, and email addresses of an undisclosed number of...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Cyberattack

item.title: Pig Butchering Scams Evolve into Global Cybercrime Menace, FBI Warns
item.description:
A new threat intelligence report, supported by warnings from the FBI, details the rapid evolution of "Pig Butchering" scams into one of the most economically damaging forms of global cybercrime. These sophisticated, long-con investment schemes leverage social engineering, emotional grooming, and fra...

item.title: Retailers Unprepared for AI-Powered Cyberattack Tsunami, Report Warns
item.description:
A new report from managed security provider LevelBlue reveals a troubling state of cybersecurity in the retail sector. item.title: Stealthy Phishing Attack Uses HTML Smuggling & Telegram Bots to Steal Credentials
item.description:
A sophisticated phishing campaign is targeting organizations across Central and Eastern Europe, using HTML smuggling to deliver credential harvesting forms. item.title: Massive 'I Paid Twice' Phishing Scheme Defrauds Booking.com Hotels and Guests
item.description:
A sophisticated global phishing campaign named 'I Paid Twice' is targeting hotels on Booking.com and Expedia, compromising their administrative accounts to defraud guests. Since at least April 2025, attackers have been using social engineering and the PureRAT malware to gain access to hotel systems....

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Cyberattack

item.title: Finance Execs Targeted in Sophisticated LinkedIn Phishing Scheme with Fake Board Invites
item.description:
A sophisticated phishing campaign is targeting finance executives through LinkedIn direct messages, using fake invitations to an executive board as a lure. The multi-stage attack, detailed by Push Security, aims to harvest Microsoft credentials and session cookies to bypass MFA. The attack chain lev...
